page.title: 08County Elections,Bitteswell
page.content:
In the May 1985 County Council elections in the Blaby Constituency, Conservative won the overall election by 5449 votes from Labour. In the Lutterworth Ward,which includes Bitteswell,Conservative won by 72 votes.The winning Councillor T.Mattock who got 1685 votes.The Labour representative was P.Knight (1613 votes) and the Alliance MP was C.Griffith(593 votes).Peter Knight had been head of Lutterworth for four years,but admitted defeat to T.Mattock who praised his work. {LEICESTERSHIRE RESULTS Conservative _ 107,044 Labour _ 95,109 Alliance _ 71,546
About 49% of the people who could have voted actually voted for the main parties.
